meanings.sent1: The children's imaginarie adventures took them to far-off lands.
meanings.sent2: Her imaginarie stories captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat's imaginarie friend was a talking mouse.
meanings.sent4: His imaginarie world was filled with colorful creatures.
meanings.sent5: The artist's imaginarie paintings were surreal and dreamlike.

meanings.definition: A person who is prone to imagining things.
meanings.sent1: She was known as the neighborhood's biggest imaginarie.
meanings.sent2: The writer was considered an imaginarie by his friends.
meanings.sent3: The imaginarie always had interesting tales to share.
meanings.sent4: Becoming an imaginarie was her dream job.
meanings.sent5: The child's imaginarie was always active and creative.

meanings.definition: A concept or idea that is not based in reality.
meanings.sent1: The theory of time travel was just an imaginarie for many years.
meanings.sent2: His belief in aliens was dismissed as an imaginarie by skeptics.
meanings.sent3: The unicorn was considered an imaginarie creature by most.
meanings.sent4: The treasure map turned out to be an imaginarie created by the prankster.
meanings.sent5: The idea of flying cars was once just an imaginarie dream.
